Posts.Content: AngelLynn wrote: Over the previous 5 years, I have endured 14 biopsies - some of which were presumed to be malignant but an additional finding is closer to malignant than I am comfortable with. I am going to copy some of the descriptions below and would appreciate your feedback. I am very overwhelmed right now and have to wait 9 more days to biopsy. "There are scattered enhancing foci in both breast. Some of the foci of enhancement are in a linear distribution in the right, outer breast. While the distribution is unchanged from the prior study there is increased enhancement intensity. Specifically, the most anterior of the foci in the right upper out breast is larger and show rapid rise and washout kinetics. Conclusion: Increased size and intensity with washout of the most anterior focus in the region of linear non mass enchancement. MR Guided biosy is recommened followed by repeat MRI if benign. BI RADS 4" Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Guidance AngelLynn mustlovepoodles

Posts.Content: May 5, 2015 09:11PM AngelLynn wrote: Ok, so my background is playing a huge role in this. I have had benign nodules with well over 8 biopsies prior to this mass being uncovered. I have enough benign masses that a mammogram and ultrasound was unable to show pick up on the other mass due to the obstruction. This mass was uncovered on MRI and is adjacent to the axillary lymph node and is deep rooted. Due to the cluster of masses, he is recommending excision to ensure that pathology is done on the correct one. I work for the hospital as a nurse and that is why I saw the oncologist after seeing my results. He has NO doubt that it is malignant given the characteristics on the report and see the biopsy as a formality. I have 3 generations before me that have all had breast cancer. The push to get this done is to prevent the spreading of the malignant cells given the rate of growth and high risk for recurrence.
Posts.Title: Confirmed BC today and having bilateral mastectomy next week AngelLynn inks

Posts.Content: AngelLynn wrote: Hey, ladies! I just joined the forum and am looking for clarity! I have had fibrocystic/fibroadenomas over the past couple of years but I had a MRI last week for a nodule and they found a 9cm x 5cm "nonmass enhancement." I am now scheduled for a MRI guided biopsy next week. I am getting a little antsy given the size of the mass. I have had multiple biopsies but this seems so different. Doesn't that seem like a large mass? Am I overreacting? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Looking for answers AngelLynn AngelLynn

Posts.Content: May 3, 2015 04:06PM AngelLynn wrote: I had an oncologist look at the MRI and it isn't good news. He wants to excise the mass ASAP and says its only to get staging bc he has no doubt that it is malignant. So, I will meet with him tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Looking for answers AngelLynn AngelLynn

Posts.Content: May 6, 2015 02:43PM AngelLynn wrote: The excisional biopsy is being done because of the size and irregularity of the mass. Since, I have so many benign areas they want to make sure they get the right one and remove it from growing anymore. The bilateral mastectomy is being recommended because I have storng family history of BC.
Posts.Title: Confirmed BC today and having bilateral mastectomy next week AngelLynn inks

Posts.Content: AngelLynn wrote: I am very thankful for this group, as I found it while I was waiting on my MRI results. THe oncologist said those words today and my heart dropped. They want to do an excisional biopsy very soon and he wants the mastectomy done by the end of next week. I am only 36 years old!!! I have so many questions and would love some feedback from the group. I am lost and confused. HELP!!!!!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confirmed BC today and having bilateral mastectomy next week AngelLynn inks

Posts.Content: May 13, 2015 03:54PM AngelLynn wrote: This response really bothers me, especially since I work for the hospital. The physicians are not only my coworkers, but also personal friends of mine. There is not one of them that is looking to get paid twice.
